714744f-a.text:
159-161 East 87th Street, north side, east of Lexington Avenue.
No. 159 is the Hook & Ladder Company, No. 13.
March 29, 1929.
P. L. Sperr.
NVEG ~~ E629

714745f-a.text:
125-133 East 87th Street, adjoining and west of the N.W. corner
of Lexington Avenue.
March 29, 1929.
P. L. Sperr.

721075f-a.text:
Lexington Ave., east side, north from East 87th Street.
August 13, 1937.
George D. Chinn.

721076f-c.text:
(1)
Lexington Ave., west side, south from East 88th to 87th Streets, showing lImmanuel Ltheran Church at the S.W. corner of the former,
and a demolition, at the N.W. corner of the latter.
August 13, 1937.
George D. Chinn.
(2)
1290-98 Lexington Ave., at the N.W. corner of East 87th Street, showing a 5-story apartment house, the Columbia, under demolitiom, Thtw site, in conjunction with Nos. 133 to 125 East 87th Street (left) will be improved with a modern structure for the Consolidated
Gas and Electric Co., as their Yorkville office.
August 13, 1937.
George D. Chinn.
(3)
An extensive view northward on the west side of the Ave. and showing the new 2-story structure that will house the Yorkville office
of the Consolidated Gas and Electric Co.
November 14, 1937.
P. L. Sperr.
